name: Lazyweb: I’m in the market for an extremely compact travel power strip, especially for use on airplanes that feature very fiddly, loose power outlets that many power bricks fall out of easily. Shoot me some suggestions if you have them!

content.html: Lazyweb: I’m in the market for an extremely compact travel power strip, especially for use on airplanes that feature very fiddly, loose power outlets that many power bricks fall out of easily. Shoot me some suggestions if you have them!

summary: I keep one of these in my laptop bag and it's perfect for those loose outlets on planes. The attached short cord makes it easy to maneuver into position too, vs a rigid plug. amzn.to/2nnCtPs

content.html: I keep one of these in my laptop bag and it's perfect for those loose outlets on planes. The attached short cord makes it easy to maneuver into position too, vs a rigid plug. amzn.to/2nnCtPs

summary: ugh airplane outlets have been driving me up the wall lately! I think the solution is to get a plug that's at a 90 degree angle so that the cord hangs straight down instead of out first. But also the plane outlets support every country's plug so maybe getting a small UK power strip is the best since that's the grippiest one?

summary: @cleverdevil I find this thing to be indispensable when traveling. Pair it with an extension cord and you have an awesome reconfigurable travel-size power strip.
